question_title: Will the community prediction be higher than 34.00% on 2026-02-15 for the Metaculus question "Will Keir Starmer cease to be Prime Minister of the UK during 2026?"?
summary: The community prediction has already moved from 34% to 35% since Feb 1, crossing the threshold. The question is now whether it will drop back to ≤34% over 13 days. Given ongoing political turmoil around Starmer (leadership challenge speculation, -49 approval, multiple challengers positioning), continued negative news coverage, and Manifold Markets pricing the underlying event higher at 40-42%, I assess there's approximately 72% probability the CP remains above 34%. The main risk is normal prediction volatility causing a 1+ point fluctuation downward.

factors.description: CP already at 35%, above the 34% threshold - prediction just needs to stay flat or rise
Manifold Markets prices the underlying question at 40-42% vs Metaculus 35%, suggesting upward pressure on Metaculus
Ongoing political turmoil: leadership speculation with Rayner, Streeting, Burnham; upcoming by-election; -49 approval rating
Prediction volatility - 1% fluctuation over 13 days is plausible
No immediate catalyst - key events (by-election Feb 26, local elections May 7) occur after resolution
